runs.comm: too much width, and that's walloped through the covers. Cracking start for Pakistan
tighter line and defended off the front foot this time

chaos - flicked round the corner and an instant call ... and a belated rejection. Ross Taylor at square leg had time to take aim, but missed by an inch as McCullum hurtled despairingly up to the stumps
Taylor fields again, but no fears this time
flicked off the legs and fielded at midwicket. Tighter line now from Bond
slower ball and spotted early, Hafeez picks up and over the leg-side, a couple of bounces and fielded at deep backward square
straight and accurate, defended into the covers
a genuine edge, and McCullum watches it fly past his right ear! Nazir was forcing off the back foot, and who knows what the keeper was thinking. That was never first slip's catch
walloped. That's how to make New Zealand pay. Like a tracer bullet through point
driven into the off side, and well fielded this time
a flashing, windmill-esque cut shot, and that picked the gap superbly between gully and third man. Yet more runs in an expensive (and unlucky) over
dragged short and too wide as well, but point stoops to field
that's poor from Bond - he knows where you can and can't bowl in limited-overs cricket, and short and wide outside off is not the spot
runs are coming at a deluge here. Hafeez shaped to pull and gloved it up and away down to fine leg
better line and length, and fielded at point, but that was timed nicely as well. Pakistan are timing it well
slower ball, nurdled down to third man, who fields in the long-barrier position and sends in a speculative return
better line and length now, and defended out to point, who is being kept busy. No swing as yet
a slightly uncertain defensive stroke from Nazir, who seems a bit startled by some extra lift off the pitch. Either way, the ball was safely negotiated and fielded at short leg
full and angling in to leg stump, turned to midwicket
too short, but Hafeez doesn't time his pull shot. Deep square leg fields on the rope
this one is timed, but almost too well. The shot lands half a yard in front of Ross Taylor, who does well not be be nutmegged by the bounce
full length and straight, the ball bobbles out to point off an inside-edge, and a quick single results
full again, on leg stump this time, but no joy with an attempted flick for Nazir
pulled off a good length, and Taylor fields again at deep square leg
full and straight
tucked down to short third man off the back foot
hint of an appeal as the ball scuttles after pitching, but possibly sneaking down leg. A two-paced pitch?
better bowling from Bond, who sends down a slower ball that tweaks past the edge
short and clobbered! That wasn't so short but Hafeez was into position so early, and that flew fast and flat over midwicket
clever batting, just a delicate deflection down the leg-side, and Bond's figures are bruised yet further
way down the leg-side
short and too wide, flailed through the covers off the back foot. Not quite timed, and fielded with a headlong slide inside the rope
slapped down to third man, a bit chancy, but Pakistan can afford that at the moment
another single down to third man
much better length, full and straight, and blocked down to mid-off with a full face of the bat
right in the slot, Hafeez was waiting for this one, and lifted a slower ball straight back over the bowler's head, and all the way into the stand!
quicker delivery to finish, but Pakistan are marching ever onwards
twirled onto a good length from around the wicket, and blocked out to midwicket
beasted over cow corner with two steps down the track and a huge swing of the blade! Massive strike
slower delivery, more flighted, and Vincent in the covers fields with a tumble
turned off the hip and fielded by the keeper
beautiful delivery! That was the arm-ball and Nazir was done like a kipper. Vettori was pleading for the decision, but Harper's unmoved. That was close! Maybe just sneaking down leg
full stride of the front leg and patted into the covers

and they've got the breakthrough! Taufel raises where Harper declined. Hafeez was down in position to sweep, moving outside off stump, and struck in front of middle. Fair enough, and that's timely to say the least
defended into the leg-side
tidy enough so far
floated onto a good length outside off stump, Younis bullies that through the leg-side with a big swing of the bat
a bit of width, and cracked out to deep cover
nurdled down to third man, and that's the end of an important over for New Zealand
dragged down the pitch and defends back to the bowler. Teasing flight
props forward from the crease this time
faster and flatter, and nudged round the corner
that's vast. Nazir was playing by numbers there, and chose the right ball to wallop. A quickstep down the wicket and a monstrous heave over long-off
swept to midwicket to rotate the strike
another arm-ball that Younis plays off the back foot to gully. Lovely variation, but no success so far
low full toss spanked high and hard off the bottom of the bat up and way over long-off
calmer defence now
another clean hit but boomed towards midwicket and tidied up out there
good recovery from Styris, planting on a good length in front of off
pushes him on the back foot for a rock-solid back-foot defence
on the dot again, the batsman tries to push it off the face into short midwicket but is too late on the shot and the ball rolls harmlessly there. No chance of a run
on the spot first up, Younis presses forward in defence, stunning the pace right out of the ball
a smooth, easy Sunday-morning-kind-of drive out to straight long-on
worked into the leg-side again, squarer
waits, and waits, as Patel squeezes the ball in from off, before it's eased gently into the off-side
down the track, attacking intent from Younis, but it's to remain intent only as he drives straight towards mid-on
again he comes down and again there's a dot as he drives straight back to Patel
dropped. Swiped from outside off and that's a shocker from Taylor at mid-on - straight into his hands, and out again
swept round through the 45
chipped high on the off-side this time
Nazir now gets to his half-century with a belter of a drive up and over straight long-on
extraordinary - hooks a top edge right over the keeper, hardly the prettiest shot, but it travels, all right
driven to mid-on
reaches out for a reverse sweep which he hardly connects with as it whispers down to fine leg
had to go this time - tried to sweep a faster delivery, swooping very low in doing so, and was rapped straight in front of off
taken from outside off and worked to fine leg
driven out to deep cover
width outside off, turns in a touch, but it's still wide enough to be cut easily behind point to bring up Pakistan's hundred
outside off, slightly straighter, driven out to long-on
outside off, worked into short midwicket
in towards middle-and-leg, the batsman hardly giving himself room - in fact he was cramped - to cut into the off-side
backed away to try to cut a straight one and got a thin edge through which McCullum snapped tidily
waits on the back foot and drives into the covers for a quick single but, wait, Vincent is in trouble as Patel's throw crashes into the back of his head at close quarters
waits patiently to defend on the back foot
from outside off, Afridi considers the cover drive before recovering to make a very straight shape with body and bat in playing a back-foot defence. Well adjusted, good patience
horrible low full toss outside off, driven kindly out inside the cover boundary
slower ball, picked up with a scooped drive through extra cover
gone this time, though - driven flat on the up straight to Fulton at mid-off
slower delivery down the off channel, waited and left
slowish yorker, digs out a single on the off-side
huge bouncer - too huge for Umpire Harper's liking
bottom-of-the-bat straight drive sails high - but dry - eluding some converging fielders inside the long-off boundary
up there, straight, driven out easily to mid-on
driven out again to mid-on and the strike's rotated once more
driven out to the covers
reaches out to push the ball to cover where Vettori is clean, and not to mention tidy, in picking up
waits and presses an easy single into the midwicket
full toss seems to slip out of his hand, squiggling in at midriff height outside off and driven back out to long-on
comes out and drives out to long-on for a comfortable single
worked out to midwicket
down the pitch and tracked right over to the rope, bissecting midwicket and mid-on - my, that was forcefully struck
pitches on middle and follows the batsman as he hops back and pushes off the back foot to mid-on
pops up, but harmlessly
outside off, turning into the right hander who pushes to mid-on for a strike-stealer
a throaty, gurgly roar - but outside the line
comes down the track, pushing a single out to long-on
comes down and defends forward
outside off and driven to the covers
touch of flight, worked off the toes and they come back for two, safely enough in the end
worked into the leg-side
driven out to a straight mid-on
...and is instantly punctured with a straight six over mid-off
swept easily behind square for a single
dropped. Nathan McCullum made good ground to meet the ball deep near the midwicket boundary
huge six over midwicket - massive pull that's caught somewhere in the crowd who have now, as is traditional, gone wild
